column4: sometimes you need to reboot after setting samba up also make sure you got the shares set on windows might also reboot windows
The shares showed up in Gutsy, and I've already rebooted my heron install since installing / configuring samba
What's a WINS server and do i need that?
No, that package wasn't installed.. I just installed it now
Ah.. now i have some options to configure.. thank you :)
that should help i too have had probs with seeing the wins share til i installed that
Neither of my windows computers are showing up yet though in Network
in the samba config  under prefrences in it for server settings set it to the name you use on windows for the net group
also prob wanna check your settings on the windows machine as to how you got the shareing set
The share i want to access is wide open
k then it should show up are you seeing anything at all like a workgroup icon
did ya reboot the windows machine
Not since installing the samba-config or whatever, but many i've rebooted it many times in general
Might've found a solution.  Someone else mentioned /etc/nsswitch.conf needing "wins" in the hosts line.   Sure enough, it was missing.  Why was this removed in hardy?
got me prob outta date and not being updated????
